metadata.Title: CVE-2013-1439 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The "faster LJPEG decoder" in libraw 0.13.x, 0.14.x, and 0.15.x before 0.15.4 allows context-dependent attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference) via a crafted photo file.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-1439` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libkdcraw-data - 4:4.11.1-0ubuntu2
libkdcraw23 - 4:4.11.1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

libraw-bin - 0.15.3-1ubuntu1
libraw9 - 0.15.3-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> upstream says to use 0.14-stable branch from github repo

criterions.comment: darktable: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
libkdcraw package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4:4.11.1-0ubuntu2').
libraw package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.3-1ubuntu1').
